get.description: Retrieve a list of corporations that a user has access to in Carta.

400.description: Returned if required fields are omitted or if provided fields fail validation.

401.description: Returned if a valid `Authorization` header has not been included with the request.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to access the resource.

500.description: Returned if an unexpected internal server error is encountered.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description:
The maximum number of corporations to return. The service may return fewer than this value.

If unspecified, at most 25 corporations will be returned.

The maximum value is 50; values above 50 will be coerced to 50.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description:
A page token received as `nextPageToken` in a previous List Corporations response. Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page.

When paginating, all other parameters must be kept consistent with those used in the request where the page token was obtained.

get.description: Retrieve all compensation benchmarks based on a corporation's compensation plan in Carta Total Compensation.

400.description: Returned if required fields are omitted or if provided fields fail validation.

401.description: Returned if a valid `Authorization` header has not been included with the request.

403.description: Returned when the user does not have permission to access the resource.

500.description: Returned if an unexpected internal server error is encountered.

parameters.name: corporationId
parameters.description: The identifier of the corporation or issuer. Identifiers can be retrieved via the List Corporations endpoint.

parameters.name: postMoneyValuationBucket
parameters.description: The peer group used to segment the underlying data. Possible values can be retrieved from the `GetCompensationBenchmarkAttributes` endpoint.

parameters.name: geoAdjustmentLocation
parameters.description: The location used to geo-adjust the benchmarks. Possible values can be retrieved from the `GetCompensationBenchmarkAttributes` endpoint.

parameters.name: jobArea
parameters.description: The job area that the underlying data is segmented by. Possible values can be retrieved from the `GetCompensationBenchmarkAttributes` endpoint.

parameters.name: compensationType
parameters.description:
The compensation type of the benchmark. Possible values can be retrieved from the `GetCompensationBenchmarkAttributes` endpoint.

An empty `compensationType` returns benchmark values for all compensation types.

parameters.name: jobSpecialization
parameters.description:
The job specialization that the underlying data is segmented by. Possible values can be retrieved from the `GetCompensationBenchmarkAttributes` endpoint.

An empty `jobSpecialization` returns the benchmarks for the roll-up segment.

parameters.name: jobLevel
parameters.description:
The job level that the underlying data is segmented by. Possible values can be retrieved from the `GetCompensationBenchmarkAttributes` endpoint.

An empty job_level returns the benchmarks for all job levels.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description:
The maximum number of benchmarks to return. The service may return fewer than this value.

If unspecified, at most 100 benchmarks will be returned.

The maximum value is 100; values above 100 will be coerced to 100.

parameters.name: pageToken
parameters.description:
A page token received as `nextPageToken` in a previous Get Compensation Benchmarks response. Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page.

When paginating, all other parameters must be kept consistent with those used in the request where the page token was obtained.

parameters.name: draftOptionGrantSetId
parameters.description:
The identifier of the draft option grant set will contain the draft option grant. 
 The LATEST string can be used as an `draft_option_grant_set_id` in case you dont want to pin a specific draft option grant set. 
 By using LATEST, it will look for the most recently created draft option grant set for the issuer, and create the draft option grant in that set. 
 If no draft option grant set exists, it will create a new draft option grant set and use it.

post.description:
Upload an [Open Cap Table Format (OCF)](https://github.com/Open-Cap-Table-Coalition/Open-Cap-Format-OCF) package in binary format to be processed.

If the OCF package is successfully uploaded, the `OpenCapTablesService` will begin processing the data with the goal of onboarding the Issuer and its related data on to the Carta platform.

Supplying an OCF package to this endpoint will result in the creation of an Open Cap Table record to track the progress of processing the data from the OCF package. This record will be returned in the case of a successful response. This record can also be queried via the `GetCapTable` endpoint.

@type.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

id.description:
The identifier of the capitalization table.

A company's primary capitalization table can be retrieved by reusing the `companyId` value here. Pro forma capitalization tables have unique identifiers.

firmId.description: The identifier of the firm holding the investment.

fundId.description: The identifier of the fund holding the investment.

name.description: The name of the capitalization table. Primary capitalization tables are named Primary. Pro forma capitalization tables have user defined names.

asOfDate.description: The date as of which the capitalization table is based. This is more relevant for pro forma capitalization tables, where this field will represent the date the pro forma was created. For primary capitalization tables, this field will default to the date when the capitalization table was retrieved (i.e., today's date).

The valuation cap sets a maximum value at which a convertible security will convert into equity in the financing round.

This valuation cap stands regardless of the valuation of the financing round.

discountPercentage.description: The discount applied to the price per share when the note holder will purchase shares in the next fundraising round. 1 represents 1%.

changeInControlPercent.description: Denotes any premium or multiplier applied to the `cash_paid` in the event of a change in control prior to the maturity date. 1 represents 1%.

publicapiinvestorssecuritiesv1alpha1Exer.description:
The status of an exercise.

 - EXERCISE_STATUS_UNSPECIFIED: Denotes the absence of a value.
 - PENDING: The exercise is in pending state.
 - COMPLETE: The exercise is complete and a warrant was issued.
 - CANCELED: The exercise is cancelled.

The type of an exercise request.

 - EXERCISE_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Denotes the absence of a value.
 - CASH: The cost of exercise was covered in cash.
 - CASHLESS: The cost of exercise was covered by selling shares.
 - NET: The cost of exercise was covered by withholding shares.
 - BLENDED: The cost of exercise was covered by a combination of cash and selling of shares.

publicapiinvestorssecuritiesv1alpha1Inte.description:
The length of time over which the interest due to the lender is calculated.

 - INTEREST_ACCRUAL_PERIOD_UNSPECIFIED: Denotes the absence of a value.

The enumerated string defining if the interest accrual is compounding or not, and the period used in calculating compounded interest. 
Simple interest is calculated only on the principal amount of the loan, while compound interest is calculated on the principal amount and also on the accumulated interest of the previous period.

 - INTEREST_COMPOUNDING_PERIOD_UNSPECIFIED: Denotes the absence of a value.

publicapiissuerssecuritiesv1alpha1Option.description: An option grant is a contract that gives an employee the right to purchase a company's stock at a set price.

id.description: The identifier of the option grant vesting event.

vestDate.description:
The date of the vesting event.

For milestone-based vesting events, `vestDate` will be omitted until the security has vested.

quantity.description:
The number of shares being vested in this vesting event by this events date.

*Deprecated: use `maxQuantity`, `targetQuantity`, `vestedQuantity` fields instead.*

For vesting events from strictly time-based vesting schedules, this field will be the amount of shares vesting in the tranche represented by this vesting event, regardless of whether the tranche has actually vested.

For vesting events with performance conditions, this field will be set to either:
- if the performance condition has not been achieved, the maximum quantity of shares that could be vested
- if the performance condition has been achieved, the target quantity of shares that are vested based on the payout details of the performance condition
quantity.title: The number of shares being vested in this vesting event by this events date. Deprecated.

isoQuantity.description: The total number of ISOs vested in this vesting event.

nsoQuantity.description: The total number of NSOs vested in this vesting event.

performanceCondition.description:
Indicates that this vesting event has associated performance or milestone vesting conditions.

`performanceCondition` will be `true` for milestone- and performance-based vesting events.

For performance-based vesting events, `performanceCondition` indicates that a performance condition exists, not that it has been met.

vested.description: Indicates that this vesting event has vested.

maxQuantity.description:
The maximum number of shares vested in this vesting event.

For vesting events with performance conditions, this value will be based on the maximum payout defined within the performance condition.

For regular time-based vesting events, this value will be equivalent to the target_payout field.
maxQuantity.title: The maximum number of shares vested in this vesting event.

targetQuantity.description:
The target number of shares vested in this vesting event.

The target number of shares reflects the number of shares that have vested or should vest within the vesting event independent of any performance condition payout details.

If this vesting event has no performance condition, then this value will reflect the value that is or will be in the `vestedQuantity` field.
targetQuantity.title: The target number of shares vested in this vesting event.

vestedQuantity.description:
The actual number of shares vested in this vesting event.

This value will only be set if the vesting event is actually vested (i.e., the `vested` field is `true`). Otherwise, if the vesting event is unvested, then this value will be unset.
vestedQuantity.title: The actual number of shares vested in this vesting event.

 - EX_ADVISOR: Stakeholder is an ex-advisor
 - BOARD_MEMBER: Stakeholder is a board member
 - CONSULTANT: Stakeholder is a consultant
 - EX_CONSULTANT: Stakeholder is an ex-consultant
 - EMPLOYEE: Stakeholder is an employee
 - EX_EMPLOYEE: Stakeholder is an ex-employee
 - EXECUTIVE: Stakeholder is an executive
 - FOUNDER: Stakeholder is a founder
 - INTERNATIONAL_EMPLOYEE: Stakeholder is an international employee

 - OFFICER: Stakeholder is an officer

This valuation cap stands regardless of the valuation of the financing round.

id.description: The identifier of the restricted stock award vesting event.

vestDate.description:
The date of the vesting event.

For milestone-based vesting events, `vestDate` will be omitted until the security has vested.

quantity.description:
The number of shares being vested in this vesting event by this events date.

*Deprecated: use `maxQuantity`, `targetQuantity`, and `vestedQuantity` fields instead.*

For vesting events from strictly time-based vesting schedules, this field will be the amount of shares vesting in the tranche represented by this vesting event, regardless of whether the tranche has actually vested.

For vesting events with performance conditions, this field will be set to either:
- if the performance condition has not been achieved, the maximum quantity of shares that could be vested
- if the performance condition has been achieved, the target quantity of shares that are vested based on the payout details of the performance condition
quantity.title: The number of shares being vested in this vesting event by this events date. Deprecated.

performanceCondition.description:
Indicates that this vesting event has associated performance or milestone vesting conditions.

`performanceCondition` will be `true` for milestone- and performance-based vesting events.

For performance-based vesting events, `performanceCondition` indicates that a performance condition exists, not that it has been met.

vested.description: Indicates that this vesting event has vested.

maxQuantity.description:
The maximum number of shares vested in this vesting event.

For vesting events with performance conditions, this value will be based on the maximum payout defined within the performance condition.

For regular time-based vesting events, this value will be equivalent to the target_payout field.
maxQuantity.title: The maximum number of shares vested in this vesting event.

targetQuantity.description:
The target number of shares vested in this vesting event.

The target number of shares reflects the number of shares that have vested or should vest within the vesting event independent of any performance condition payout details.

If this vesting event has no performance condition, then this value will reflect the value that is or will be in the `vestedQuantity` field.
targetQuantity.title: The target number of shares vested in this vesting event.

vestedQuantity.description:
The actual number of shares vested in this vesting event.

This value will only be set if the vesting event is actually vested (i.e., the `vested` field is `true`). Otherwise, if the vesting event is unvested, then this value will be unset.
vestedQuantity.title: The actual number of shares vested in this vesting event.

For CEO Founder benchmarks, this value represents total ownership instead of an annual grant value.

The conversion price basis.

 - CONVERSION_PRICE_BASIS_UNSPECIFIED: Denotes the absence of a value
 - OUTSTANDING_SHARES: Outstanding Shares
 - OUTSTANDING_OPTIONS_AND_WARRANTS: Outstanding Options and warrants
 - UNISSUED_OPTIONS: Unissued options

v1alpha1ConvertibleTermsGrouping.description: Cap table calculations grouped by convertible terms.

noteBlockId.description: The identifier of the note block.

noteBlockName.description: The name of the note block.

conversionDiscountPercentage.description: The discount applied to the price per share when the note holder purchases shares in the next fundraising round.

conversionPriceBases.description:
This determines what securities are included in the capitalization definition that is used
to calculate conversion price, and is generally referred to as Liquidity Capitalization
or Fully Diluted Capitalization.

For post-money cap securities, the capitalization is generally defined as all outstanding
shares, all outstanding options, all converting securities (including shares converted
from post-money SAFE) but excludes the unissued option pool.

For pre-money cap securities, the capitalization is generally defined as all outstanding
shares, all outstanding options, may or may not include unissued options, and always
excludes shares from the conversion of notes.

valuationCap.description: The valuation cap sets a maximum value at which a convertible security will convert into equity in a financing round. This valuation cap remains unchanged regardless of the valuation of the financing round.

valuationCapType.description: There are two types of valuation caps: pre-money and post-money. The primary difference between the two is how the conversion price is calculated. The conversion price is calculated by dividing the valuation cap by the liquidity capitalization. For post-money valuation caps, the liquidity capitalization includes the shares that will be created from the conversion of the post-money instrument. Pre-money instruments do not include the shares that will be created upon conversion in the capitalization figure. Generally, post-money valuation caps will be explicitly labeled as post-money in the note document. When a valuation cap is stated but not specified, the valuation cap is pre-money.

liquidityPriority.description: The liquidation priority section specifies what order SAFEs will be paid out if there is a liquidity event. There is a liquidation priority section for post-money SAFEs, which states if, in a liquidity event, the SAFE will be on par with preferred. If there is no such section in agreement highlighting liquidation priority, the default should just be 'senior to preferred.'
liquidityPriority.title:
The liquidation priority section specifies what order SAFEs will be paid out if there is
a liquidity event. There is a liquidation priority section for post-money SAFEs, which
states if, in a liquidity event, the SAFE will be on par with preferred. If there is
no such section in agreement highlighting liquidation priority, the default should just
be senior to preferred."

if specifying a year by itself or a year and month where the day is not
significant.

* A full date, with non-zero year, month and day values

 - WEEKLY: Dividends accrue on a weekly basis

 - QUARTERLY: Dividends accrue on a quarterly basis

 - SIMPLE_INTEREST: Interest is calculated using simple interest
 - INTEREST_PERIOD_DAILY: Interest compounds daily
 - INTEREST_PERIOD_WEEKLY: Interest compounds weekly
 - INTEREST_PERIOD_MONTHLY: Interest compounds monthly

 - INTEREST_PERIOD_SEMI_ANNUAL: Interest compounds semi-annually

v1alpha1DraftIssuerStakeholderRelationsh.description:
The relationship of the stakeholder with the draft issuer.

 - DRAFT_ISSUER_STAKEHOLDER_RELATIONSHIP_UNSPECIFIED: Conventional default for enums. Do not use this.
 - ADVISOR: Stakeholder is an advisor
 - EX_ADVISOR: Stakeholder is an ex-advisor
 - BOARD_MEMBER: Stakeholder is a board member
 - CONSULTANT: Stakeholder is a consultant
 - EX_CONSULTANT: Stakeholder is an ex-consultant
 - EMPLOYEE: Stakeholder is an employee
 - EX_EMPLOYEE: Stakeholder is an ex-employee
 - EXECUTIVE: Stakeholder is an executive
 - FOUNDER: Stakeholder is a founder
 - INTERNATIONAL_EMPLOYEE: Stakeholder is an international employee
 - INVESTOR: Stakeholder is an investor
 - OFFICER: Stakeholder is an officer

 - INDIVIDUAL: An individual stakeholder
 - INSTITUTIONAL: An institutional stakeholder (i.e., an organization)
v1alpha1DraftIssuerStakeholderType.title: The stakeholder type

v1alpha1DraftIssuerState.description:
The draft issuer operational state.

 - DRAFT_ISSUER_STATE_UNSPECIFIED: Conventional default for enums. Do not use this.
 - ACTIVE: The draft issuer is still in draft mode.
This indicates that it should be managed through the `draftIssuers` API.
 - TRANSITIONED_TO_ISSUER: The draft issuer is no longer in draft mode and has transitioned to an issuer.
This indicates that it should be managed through the `issuers` API.

v1alpha1DraftIssuerVestingFrequency.description:
Vesting frequency.

 - DRAFT_ISSUER_VESTING_FREQUENCY_UNSPECIFIED: Conventional default for enums. Do not use this.
 - DAILY: Vesting occurs daily
 - WEEKLY: Vesting occurs weekly
 - MONTHLY: Vesting occurs monthly
 - QUARTERLY: Vesting occurs quarterly
 - SEMI_ANNUALLY: Vesting occurs semi-annually
 - ANNUALLY: Vesting occurs annually

v1alpha1DraftIssuerVestingOnDay.description:
The day of the month on which vesting occurs.

 - DRAFT_ISSUER_VESTING_ON_DAY_UNSPECIFIED: Conventional default for enums. Do not use this.
 - SAME: Vesting occurs on the same day as the start date
 - MINUS_ONE: Vesting occurs on the day before the start date
 - FIRST: Vesting occurs on the first day of the month
 - LAST: Vesting occurs on the last day of the month

cliffDuration.description: Specifies the unit of time until the vesting schedule cliff. Combine `cliffValue` and `cliffDuration` to calculate the vesting schedule cliff. E.g., if `cliffValue` is `1` and `cliffDuration` is `YEARS`, then the vesting schedule cliff is one year.

v1alpha1DraftOptionGrant.description:
A draft option grant is an object that is the precursor of an option grant before it is approved, signed, and issued.

The "draft" prefix is used to differentiate it from the final option grant object.

v1alpha1DraftSecurityState.description:
The state of a draft security that describes the lifecycle stage of the draft security and determines the actions that can be performed on it.

 - DRAFT_SECURITY_STATE_UNSPECIFIED: Denotes the absence of a value
 - DRAFT_SECURITY_STATE_DRAFTING: The draft security has been created and is in an editable state
 - DRAFT_SECURITY_STATE_PENDING_BOARD_APPROVAL: The draft has been submitted for board approval and is in a read-only state
 - DRAFT_SECURITY_STATE_ISSUED: The draft has been sent to signatories to be signed and issued and is in a read-only state

 - EXERCISE_PERIOD_DAY: The exercise period will be expressed in days
 - EXERCISE_PERIOD_MONTH: The exercise period will be expressed in months
 - EXERCISE_PERIOD_YEAR: The exercise period will be expressed in years

 - AWAITING_TAX_WITHHOLDING: The exercise is created but does not have tax withholding information yet.
 - PENDING: The exercise request is pending.
 - COMPLETE: The exercise request is complete.

 - CASH_EXERCISE: The cost of exercise was covered in cash.
 - CASHLESS_EXERCISE: The cost of exercise was covered by selling shares.
 - NET_EXERCISE: The cost of exercise was covered by withholding shares.
 - BLENDED: The cost of exercise was covered by a combination of cash and selling of shares.

id.description: The identifier of the share class.

prefix.description: The prefix used to identify the share class. Can only be numbers and letters. For example, CS for Common, PS for Series Seed Preferred, and PA for Series A Preferred.
prefix.title:
The prefix used to identify the share class. Can only be numbers and letters. For example, CS for Common, PS for
Series Seed Preferred, and PA for Series A Preferred

authorizedShareCount.description: The maximum number of shares allowed to be issued to investors, as laid out in the articles of incorporation.

parValue.description: The minimum price per share at which the shares must be issued. Is usually set at $0.001 or $0.0001 per share, as stated in the corporate charter.

seniority.description:
Indicates the order in which share holders will get paid. Seniority ranks high to low, with 1 being the highest and will be paid out first.

The higher the number, the less seniority the corresponding share class has.

pariPassu.description: Indicates whether this share class has equal seniority to an existing share class.

conversionRatio.description:
Conversion will be calculated with `conversionRatio` instead of `conversionPrice` if both are entered.

Conversion will be calculated with `conversionRatio` instead of `conversionPrice` if both are entered.

multiplier.description: The multiple of the original Issue price that will be paid out pursuant to the liquidation preferences.

 - TRANSACTION_TYPE_RSU_SETTLEMENT: Transaction is the settlement of a restricted stock unit.
